Procurement Officer Job at Benny Aluminium Company Limited




        
    

        
        Benny Aluminium Company Limited is a Nigerian-based construction firm specializing in aluminum and glass works, including the fabrication and installation of doors, windows, and showroom setups. Primarily located in Aba, Abia State, with additional connections to Lagos, the company is recognized for its construction services and expertise in aluminum fittings.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Procurement Officer

Job Location: Lagos 
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Prepare proposals, request quotes and negotiate purchase terms and conditions
	Prepare and issue purchase orders and agreements
	Monitor supplier performance and resolve issues and concerns
	Inspect and evaluate the quality of purchased items and resolve shortcomings
	Analyze industry and demand trends and support senior management with the development and implementation of sourcing strategies


Requirements and Skills


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Supply Chain Management or a similar field preferably with 0-10 years of experience.
	Proven work experience as a Procurement Specialist or similar role
	Good working knowledge of purchasing strategies
	Excellent communication, interpersonal and negotiation skills
	Strong analytical thinking and problem-solving skills
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office and with business application software, purchasing and resource planning systems


Salary
N120,000 - N250,000 / Month.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CVs to: bennyaluminumcoltd@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

  "title": "Warehouse & Logistics Officer",
  "description": "Katchey Companyis an ISO 9001:2015 world leading certified supplier of reliable science / medical laboratory equipmentand chemicals. Our products and solutions support organizations that use science.&nbsp;Katchey company limited is a one-stop-shop for all laboratories equipments, reagents, consumables and chemicals.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Warehouse &amp; Logistics Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking to hire aWarehouse &amp; Logistics Officer who will provide operational support to the business by managing warehouse and store activities in line with best practices.
	Coordinate local and international logistics, liaise with clearing agents and internal departments, and ensure timely and efficient order fulfillment to support overall business objectives.


Key Responsibilities
Warehouse &amp; Inventory Management:


	Receive, store, monitor, and issue goods in line with standard operating procedures and best storekeeping practices.
	Establish and maintain standards for packaging, storage, and handling of materials.
	Manage stock control, inventory accuracy, lot tracking, and shelf-life monitoring.
	Prepare and submit daily/weekly stock movement reports to Accounts.
	Provide periodic inventory and stock reports to the Line Manager.
	Ensure proper storage conditions and compliance with safety standards.


Logistics &amp; Order Fulfillment:


	Confirm consignments against packing lists and coordinate timely dispatch to customers.
	Prepare goods for domestic shipment upon receipt of authorized documentation.
	Coordinate general order logistics to ensure on-time delivery and customer satisfaction.
	Escalate unresolved issues promptly to the Line Manager.


Clearing &amp; Compliance:


	Liaise with authorized clearing agents to ensure timely clearance and delivery of shipments.
	Review shipping documentation and coordinate with Customs and inspection agencies to ensure regulatory compliance.


Cross-Functional Coordination:


	Work closely with Accounts on supplier/customer invoices, delivery notes, payments, and stock reconciliation.
	Collaborate with Business Development, Business Support, and Engineering teams on shipment documentation, supplier coordination, and inspection/testing requirements.
	Interface with all departments to ensure efficient order processing and delivery


Qualifications &amp; Experience


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree or HND in Warehousing &amp; Storage, Logistics, Supply Chain, or related field.
	3 &ndash; 4 years of relevant experience, preferably handling chemicals and laboratory equipment.


Knowledge &amp; Skills:


	Strong knowledge of inventory management procedures and stock control systems.
	Understanding of safety standards applicable to storage facilities.
	Ability to maintain accurate records and prepare reports.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications.
	Strong written and verbal communication skills.
	Good command of the English language.


Salary
N200,000 per month.

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;jobs@katchey.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

Warehouse & Logistics Officer Job at Katchey Company




        
    

        
        Katchey Companyis an ISO 9001:2015 world leading certified supplier of reliable science / medical laboratory equipmentand chemicals. Our products and solutions support organizations that use science. Katchey company limited is a one-stop-shop for all laboratories equipments, reagents, consumables and chemicals.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Warehouse & Logistics Officer

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	We are seeking to hire aWarehouse & Logistics Officer who will provide operational support to the business by managing warehouse and store activities in line with best practices.
	Coordinate local and international logistics, liaise with clearing agents and internal departments, and ensure timely and efficient order fulfillment to support overall business objectives.


Key Responsibilities
Warehouse & Inventory Management:


	Receive, store, monitor, and issue goods in line with standard operating procedures and best storekeeping practices.
	Establish and maintain standards for packaging, storage, and handling of materials.
	Manage stock control, inventory accuracy, lot tracking, and shelf-life monitoring.
	Prepare and submit daily/weekly stock movement reports to Accounts.
	Provide periodic inventory and stock reports to the Line Manager.
	Ensure proper storage conditions and compliance with safety standards.


Logistics & Order Fulfillment:


	Confirm consignments against packing lists and coordinate timely dispatch to customers.
	Prepare goods for domestic shipment upon receipt of authorized documentation.
	Coordinate general order logistics to ensure on-time delivery and customer satisfaction.
	Escalate unresolved issues promptly to the Line Manager.


Clearing & Compliance:


	Liaise with authorized clearing agents to ensure timely clearance and delivery of shipments.
	Review shipping documentation and coordinate with Customs and inspection agencies to ensure regulatory compliance.


Cross-Functional Coordination:


	Work closely with Accounts on supplier/customer invoices, delivery notes, payments, and stock reconciliation.
	Collaborate with Business Development, Business Support, and Engineering teams on shipment documentation, supplier coordination, and inspection/testing requirements.
	Interface with all departments to ensure efficient order processing and delivery


Qualifications & Experience


	Bachelor’s Degree or HND in Warehousing & Storage, Logistics, Supply Chain, or related field.
	3 – 4 years of relevant experience, preferably handling chemicals and laboratory equipment.


Knowledge & Skills:


	Strong knowledge of inventory management procedures and stock control systems.
	Understanding of safety standards applicable to storage facilities.
	Ability to maintain accurate records and prepare reports.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications.
	Strong written and verbal communication skills.
	Good command of the English language.


Salary
N200,000 per month.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: jobs@katchey.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.
